title: SoC MTS 525-0-27 Special Topics Research Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Online identity has historically been considered by the literature as distinct from face-to-face identity, in part because we tended historically to think about the Internet and online spaces as distinct from "real world" spaces. This is complicated by new technologies that allow us to interact with real people nearby and that allow us to share information about our real-world location. This means we need to reconsider how we think about both identity and location, but theories haven't always kept pace. The goal of this seminar is to explore a range of literatures on identity, anonymity and the design of both online and offline social spaces.
